item.title: 石油上涨，亚洲股市和美元保持平静
item.description: 由于以色列和伊朗之间的冲突没有降温的迹象，在央行会议密集的本周，地缘政治的不确定性又给世界经济增添了麻烦。【原文：Asian markets kept their nerve on Monday and oil prices climbed anew as the conflict between Israel and Iran showed no sign of cooling, adding geopolitical uncertainty to the world's economic troubles in a week packed with central bank meetings.】

item.title: 澳大利亚证券与投资委员会（ASIC）启动对证券交易所运营商 ASX 的调查
item.description: 澳大利亚证券监管机构周一表示，已对澳大利亚证券交易所（ASX）的治理、能力和风险管理实践展开调查。【原文：Australia's securities regulator said on Monday that it has launched an investigation into Australian bourse operator ASX's governance, capability and risk management practices.】

item.title: 日产首席执行官埃斯皮诺萨告诉《日经新闻》，日产计划减持雷诺股份
item.description: 据《日经商业报》周一报道，日产汽车首席执行官伊万-埃斯皮诺萨（Ivan Espinosa）表示，公司计划减持日产汽车在法国合作伙伴雷诺公司（Renault）的股份。【原文：Nissan Motor CEO Ivan Espinosa said that the company plans to reduce the automaker's stake in French partner Renault , the Nikkei business newspaper reported on Monday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚桑托斯公司收到 ADNOC 的收购要约，估值 187 亿美元
item.description: 澳大利亚石油和天然气生产商桑托斯公司周一表示，该公司收到了由 ADNOC 子公司 XRG P.J.S.C. 及其他公司牵头的财团提出的非约束性建议，该公司估值为 187.2 亿美元。【原文：Australian oil and gas producer Santos said on Monday it received a non-binding proposal from a consortium led by ADNOC subsidiary XRG P.J.S.C. and others, valuing the firm at $18.72 billion.】

item.title: 以伊冲突加剧供应中断担忧，油价上涨
item.description: 以色列和伊朗周日发动新一轮袭击，加剧了人们对不断升级的战事可能引发更广泛的地区冲突并大范围破坏中东石油出口的担忧，油价在周一亚洲早盘交易中跳涨。【原文：Oil prices jumped in early Asian trade on Monday after Israel and Iran launched fresh attacks on Sunday, heightening fears that escalating battle could trigger a broader regional conflict and widely disrupt oil exports from the Middle East.】

item.title: 巴黎航展在印度坠机和中东冲突的阴云下开幕
item.description: 巴黎航展将于周一开幕，届时将一如既往地大肆宣传飞机订单，但人们对印度最致命空难以及以色列和伊朗之间导弹袭击升级的担忧可能会有所缓和，这已令全球航空业感到震惊。【原文：The Paris Airshow opens on Monday with its usual fanfare of aircraft orders expected to be tempered by concerns over India’s deadliest air disaster and escalating missile strikes between Israel and Iran that have rattled the global aviation industry.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，《华盛顿邮报》正在调查针对记者的网络攻击事件
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日报道，针对《华盛顿邮报》的网络攻击破坏了几位记者的电子邮件账户，这很可能是外国政府所为。【原文：A cyberattack on the Washington Post compromised the email accounts of several journalists and was most likely the work of a foreign government, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 公司称雷诺老板德梅奥离职，此前有报道称他将领导开云集团
item.description: 雷诺汽车公司首席执行官卢卡-德梅奥周日表示，他将离开雷诺汽车公司，此前不久，《费加罗报》报道称他将接手陷入困境的奢侈品集团开云集团（Kering）。【原文：Renault chief executive Luca De Meo is leaving the carmaker, the company said on Sunday, shortly after paper Le Figaro reported he was set to take over the lead at struggling luxury group Kering .】

item.title: 独家报道美国进出口银行考虑为格陵兰稀土项目提供 1.2 亿美元贷款
item.description: 临界金属公司（Critical Metals Corp）已收到美国进出口银行（EXIM）的意向书，希望获得价值高达 1.2 亿美元的贷款，用于资助该公司在格陵兰岛的坦布瑞兹稀土矿，这将是特朗普政府首次对采矿项目进行海外投资。【原文：Critical Metals Corp has received a letter of interest from the U.S. Export-Import Bank (EXIM) for a loan worth up to $120 million to fund the company's Tanbreez rare earths mine in Greenland, in what would be the Trump administration's first overseas investment in a mining project.】

item.title: 雅诗兰黛名誉主席伦纳德-兰黛逝世，享年92岁
item.description: 雅诗兰黛周日宣布，公司名誉主席伦纳德-兰黛于周六去世，享年 92 岁。【原文：Estee Lauder said on Sunday that its chairman emeritus, Leonard Lauder, died on Satuday at the age of 92.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，中美贸易休战使军用稀土问题悬而未决
item.description: 消息人士称，中国政府尚未承诺批准美国军方供应商为战斗机和导弹系统所需的一些专用稀土磁铁的出口许可。【原文：Beijing has not committed to grant export clearance for some specialized rare-earth magnets that U.S. military suppliers need for fighter jets and missile systems, the sources said.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：随着人工智能变得越来越强大，英国电信首席执行官希望进一步裁员
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周日报道，英国电信集团首席执行官埃里森-柯克比（Allison Kirkby）表示，人工智能的进步可能会加深英国电信公司正在进行的大幅裁员。【原文：BT Group Chief Executive Allison Kirkby said advances in artificial intelligence could deepen significant job cuts under way at the British telecoms company, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 日本首相石破茂赴 G7 迫使特朗普取消汽车关税
item.description: 日本首相石破茂周日将前往加拿大与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普举行贸易谈判，希望说服特朗普放弃已经危及日本汽车公司并有可能破坏其脆弱政府的贸易关税。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba heads to Canada on Sunday for trade talks with U.S. President Donald Trump, hoping to persuade him to drop trade tariffs that have imperilled Japan's auto companies and threaten to undermine his fragile government.】

item.title: 台湾将中国华为和中芯国际列入出口管制名单
item.description: 台湾政府已将中国华为技术公司（HWT.UL）和中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司（SMIC）列入出口管制名单，其中包括塔利班和基地组织等其他被禁组织。【原文：Taiwan's government has added China's Huawei Technologies (HWT.UL) and Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) to its export control list, which includes other proscribed organisations like the Taliban and al Qaeda.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示，数以千计的美国用户无法使用埃隆-马斯克的 X 系统
item.description: 根据故障跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 的数据，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 系统在周六对美国成千上万的用户造成了故障。【原文：Elon Musk's X was down for thousands of users in the U.S. on Saturday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 波音公司下调 20 年喷气机需求预测
item.description: 波音公司周日在巴黎航展前发布的 20 年商用客机需求预测显示，预计到 2030 年，全球航空旅行需求将增长 40% 以上，这将推动未来几年对数千架新型喷气客机的需求。【原文：Boeing expects global demand for air travel to increase by more than 40% by 2030, driving the need for thousands of new jetliners in the next few years, according to its 20-year demand forecast for commercial airliners released Sunday ahead of the Paris Airshow.】

item.title: 日本政府称日美贸易谈判代表周六再次通话
item.description: 日本政府在一份声明中说，日本最高关税谈判代表赤泽亮世与美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周六通过电话进行了 30 分钟的交谈，探讨了达成贸易协议的可能性。【原文：Japan's top tariff negotiator, Ryosei Akazawa, and U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick spoke by phone for 30 minutes on Saturday and explored the possibility of a trade deal, the Japanese government said in a statement.】

item.title: 投资者因以色列-伊朗冲突和反特朗普抗议活动而焦虑不安
item.description: 在周日晚些时候市场重新开盘之前，双重风险令投资者惶惶不安，从中东战争的广泛前景升温，到全美范围内针对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的抗议活动威胁到更多的国内混乱。【原文：Dual risks kept investors on edge ahead of markets reopening late on Sunday, from heightened prospects of a broad Middle East war to U.S.-wide protests against U.S. President Donald Trump that threatened more domestic chaos.】

item.title: 亚马逊将向澳大利亚数据中心基础设施投资 130 亿澳元
item.description: 亚马逊公司周六在一篇博客文章中表示，将在2025年至2029年期间投资200亿澳元（约合129.7亿美元），用于扩建、运营和维护其在澳大利亚的数据中心基础设施，旨在增强澳大利亚的人工智能能力。【原文：Amazon will invest 20 billion Australian dollars ($12.97 billion) from 2025 to 2029 to expand, operate and maintain its data center infrastructure in Australia, aiming to bolster the nation's artificial intelligence capabilities, the company said in a blog post on Saturday.】

item.title: 西捷航空公司调查影响应用程序和内部系统的网络安全事件
item.description: 加拿大西捷航空公司（WestJet Airlines）周五发表声明称，该公司正在调查一起网络安全事件，该事件导致其移动应用程序和一些内部系统的访问中断，影响用户数量不详。【原文：Canada's WestJet Airlines is investigating a cybersecurity incident that has disrupted access to its mobile app and some internal systems, affecting an undisclosed number of users, the airlines said in a statement on Friday.】

item.title: 关于印度航空公司坠机事件及其调查的已知信息
item.description: 印度航空公司的致命空难造成至少 270 人死亡，引发了人们对世界十年来最严重航空灾难的猜测，但当局正在慢慢缩小调查范围。【原文：Air India's deadly plane crash that killed at least 270 people has triggered a wave of speculation about what led to the world's worst aviation disaster in a decade, but authorities are slowly narrowing down areas of investigation.】

item.title: 特朗普商业和收入披露要点
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在周五公布的公开财务披露报告中称，他从加密货币、高尔夫俱乐部、特许经营和其他投资项目中获得了 6 亿多美元的收入。【原文：Donald Trump reported more than $600 million in income from crypto, golf clubs, licensing and other ventures in a public financial disclosure report released on Friday.】

item.title: 据一财网报道，波音恢复向中国交付飞机，向吉祥航空交付 787-9 喷射器
item.description: 据中国媒体《一财》报道，波音公司周六向中国吉祥航空公司交付了一架新的787-9飞机，北京与华盛顿之间的贸易紧张局势有所缓和。【原文：Boeing delivered a new 787-9 aircraft to China's Juneyao Airlines on Saturday, Chinese media outlet Yicai reported, as trade tensions between Beijing and Washington ease.】

item.title: 越南国会批准到 2031 年将酒精饮料税提高至 90
item.description: 越南国会周六批准了一项提案，到 2031 年将酒精饮料特别消费税从目前的 65% 提高到 90%，尽管最高税率不会像最初提出的那样高，但这一举措将增加该行业面临的挑战。【原文：Vietnam's National Assembly on Saturday approved a proposal to raise the special consumption tax on alcoholic beverages to 90% by 2031 from the current 65%, a move that will add to challenges facing the industry even though the top rate won't be as high as first flagged.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，足球俱乐部投资者 Eagle 申请在美国上市
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，全球足球俱乐部最活跃的投资者之一 Eagle Football Holdings 已秘密申请在美国首次公开募股。【原文：Eagle Football Holdings, one of the most active investors in global football clubs, has confidentially filed for a U.S. initial public offering, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普报告从加密货币企业获得数千万美元收入
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统周五提交了其任期内的第一份公开财务披露报告，提供了他所说的有关其所持资产的最新信息，包括其家族涉足加密货币的收入。【原文：President Donald Trump filed his first public financial disclosure report of his term on Friday, providing what he said was the latest information about his holdings, including income from his family's foray into crypto currencies.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势加剧，交易商押注美国石油价格升至 80 美元
item.description: 以色列对伊朗的空袭引发了对更广泛中东冲突的担忧，交易商周五交出了自1月份以来最多的80美元西德克萨斯中质原油（WTI）看涨期权，预计油价将有更多上涨空间。【原文：Traders on Friday exchanged the most $80 West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil call options since January, expecting more upside to prices after Israeli airstrikes on Iran sparked fears of a wider Middle East conflict.】

item.title: 公司称特朗普批准了新日美钢铁协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）已批准美国钢铁公司与日本新日本制铁公司（Nippon Steel）建立合作伙伴关系，这两家公司周五表示。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump has approved the partnership between United States Steel Corp and Japan's Nippon Steel , the companies said on Friday.】

item.title: 日本贸易谈判代表：日美探讨达成贸易协议的可能性
item.description: 日本最高关税谈判代表赤泽亮世在一次简报会上说，日本和美国周五探讨了达成贸易协议的可能性，但他没有评论双方有多接近达成协议。【原文：Japan and the U.S. on Friday explored the possibility of a trade agreement, Japan's top tariff negotiator, Ryosei Akazawa, told a briefing, while refraining from commenting how close they are to reaching a deal.】

item.title: 长达数年的墨西哥反垄断案结案，谷歌拔得头筹
item.description: 墨西哥反垄断监督机构周五表示，在经过多年调查确定谷歌在墨西哥没有从事垄断行为后，该机构已对谷歌结案，使这家科技巨头免于任何可能的罚款。【原文：Mexico's antitrust watchdog said on Friday it had closed a case against Google, clearing the tech giant from any potential fines, after a multi-year investigation determined it did not engage in monopolistic practices in the country.】
